Certainly! Here are some key combinations you can consider for custom mappings in Ranger, along with their potential actions:

Ctrl + [Letter] combinations:

Ctrl + a: Select all
Ctrl + c: Copy
Ctrl + d: Mark for deletion
Ctrl + e: Edit (open in default editor)
Ctrl + f: Find/search
Ctrl + n: Create new directory
Ctrl + s: Toggle selection
Ctrl + v: Paste
Ctrl + w: Close current tab or pane
Ctrl + x: Cut
Alt + [Letter] combinations:

Alt + b: Bookmark current directory
Alt + d: Bookmark manager
Alt + e: Open terminal in current directory
Alt + f: Toggle flat view
Alt + g: Go to specified directory
Alt + m: Toggle file permissions display
Alt + s: Toggle sorting options
Alt + t: Toggle hidden files visibility
Alt + u: Go up one directory
Alt + v: Toggle preview pane
Shift + [Letter] combinations:

Shift + a: Select all files with the same extension
Shift + d: Toggle directory sorting
Shift + e: Rename
Shift + f: Toggle full screen
Shift + g: Go to bottom of the directory
Shift + m: Mark files based on a pattern
Shift + n: Toggle line numbers display
Shift + s: Select files matching a pattern
Shift + t: Go to top of the directory
Shift + u: Undo last action
Ctrl + Shift + [Letter] combinations:

Ctrl + Shift + d: Duplicate selected files
Ctrl + Shift + e: Execute custom shell command
Ctrl + Shift + f: Toggle filtering
Ctrl + Shift + g: Go to specified bookmark
Ctrl + Shift + n: Toggle file details display
Ctrl + Shift + s: Toggle smooth scrolling
Ctrl + Shift + t: Toggle tag display
Ctrl + Shift + u: Redo last action
Ctrl + Shift + v: View selected files in a pager
Ctrl + Shift + w: Open current directory in a new tab
These are just a few suggestions to get you started. You can mix and match these combinations based on your preferences and workflow in Ranger.
